channel.title: LAN Server?
channel.description: Dunno where to put this, I want to play with my bro and sis on LAN with a cable, Is this possible? If so how Thanks

item.title: LAN Server?
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

tack3rs:

Right so when i use this none of the computers or laptops will need to actually be connected to the internet, Just by cable to one pc?

Yes, you shouldn’t need the internet at all. Tell me if you have any problems.

Read full topic

item.title: LAN Server?
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

Go to Start -> Run -> then type “cmd” (without the quotes) into the run box and press enter.

When command prompt comes up type “ipconfig /all” (again, without the quotes) and a lot of writing should come up. You will need to be connected to the network you plan to use at this stage.

Scroll down until you see something like “Ethernet adapter Local Area Connection:” (if you’re using a cable, which you said you would be). Underneath that there should be a lot of fields and values, look for the one that says “IPv4 Address. . . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.x.x” this tells you what your IP on the local area network is.

Then, when you host a server on your computer, someone on the network can connect by putting “192.168.x.x” (your IP) as the IP of the server.

Some of that was really basic, and some of it might need more explanation, please tell me if anything needs clarification.

Read full topic

item.title: LAN Server?
item.dc:creator: @dannydude8 dannydude8
item.description:
@dannydude8 wrote:

[quote=“mark033, post:6, topic:348058”][quote author=dannydude8 link=topic=444439.msg3263310#msg3263310 date=1278674624]

Im doing Hamachi between my friend that lives less then 10 miles away from me so me and him can figure out what were going to do with are new server

you should really portforward i dont play hamachi servers well ones that are public. If you ever get a server started get no-ip portforwarded believe me. A public hamachi is just waiting for a attack on your pc
[/quote]

Yeah, but a private Hamachi is a great way to play with friends that aren’t on your local network.[/quote]
Yeah, thats why i said i dont play on public hamachi servers.

Read full topic

item.title: LAN Server?
item.dc:creator: @dannydude8 dannydude8
item.description:
@dannydude8 wrote:

Here is your options.

#1 If all of your pc are connected to a router you can find the router ip most of the time 192.168.2.1 Please note im not talking to your global ip. go into cmd type in ipconfig /all and use the default gateway to connect.

#2 Hamachi. Very easy DL on all the computers make a network have all the computers join that network and connect hamachi ips are usually 5.10.139.86

Read full topic

item.title: LAN Server?
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

Yes, it is possible. It’s actually very easy. You just need to find the local IP address of the computer that it is hosted on.

What operating system are you using and how experienced are you at networks?

Read full topic
